description: Write a method that extracts the domain portion from an email address using string parsing. The method should return the part after the '@' symbol for well-formed emails, and null for invalid or malformed input.

Write a method that checks whether a given string is a valid IPv4 address in dotted-decimal notation (four octets 0-255). Return true if valid, otherwise false. The method should treat null or malformed input safely.

Write a method that determines whether a string represents a valid hexadecimal number (digits 0-9, letters a-f/A-F). Return true if valid, false otherwise. The method must handle null or empty input without throwing exceptions.

Write a method that checks whether a string follows a basic URL format, beginning with "http://" or "https://" and containing a valid domain part. Return true if valid, false otherwise. The method must handle malformed or null input safely.

Write a method that safely converts a string to an integer only if it represents a valid integer format (optional leading sign, digits). Return the converted integer value if valid, otherwise return 0. The method must protect against null or invalid input and not throw exceptions.

Write a method that checks whether a given filename ends with a specific extension (e.g., ".txt"). Return true if it ends with the extension, false otherwise. The method must handle null and short strings safely.
Write a method that checks if an integer represents a valid TCP/UDP port number (1-65535). Return true if valid, false otherwise. The method must handle negative or out-of-range values safely.

Write a method that removes leading and trailing whitespace characters from a string and returns the trimmed string, or null if invalid input. The original string should not be modified, and null input must be handled safely.
Write a method that checks whether a string contains only numeric digits (0-9). Return true if yes, otherwise false. The method should handle null or empty input without throwing exceptions.

Write a method that extracts a substring from a source string given a start index and length, performing bounds checks. Return the substring if valid, otherwise return null. Must prevent IndexOutOfBoundsException or invalid operations.
Write a method that checks if a double temperature value falls within a reasonable range (-100.0 to 200.0). Return true if valid, false otherwise. Must handle NaN or extreme values safely.

Write a method to validate a username: it must only contain alphanumeric characters and underscores, and be between 3 and 20 characters long. Return true if valid, false otherwise. Must safely handle null or empty input.
Write a method that divides two integers safely. If the divisor is zero, the method should return 0 instead of throwing ArithmeticException. Must handle any input safely.

Write a method that checks if a password string meets minimum complexity: at least 8 characters, contains uppercase, lowercase and digit. Return true if strong, false otherwise. Handle null input safely.
Write a method that checks whether an integer year falls within the valid range 1900-2100. Return true if valid, false otherwise. Must handle extreme or negative values safely.
Write a method that verifies whether a string consists only of '0' and '1' characters. Return true if yes, false otherwise. Must safely handle null or empty input.

Write a method that checks if a string represents a valid floating-point number (e.g., optional sign, digits, decimal point). Return true if valid, false otherwise. Must not throw exceptions on null or malformed input.
Write a method that given a CSV line string and an index, extracts the integer at that index if valid, otherwise returns 0. Must validate input safely and handle out-of-bounds indices.
Write a method that verifies a file path is safe, i.e., it does not contain ".." components or invalid characters, returning true if safe, false otherwise. Must handle null input safely.
Write a method that checks whether a JSON key string is alphanumeric and contains no whitespace. Return true if valid, false otherwise. Must handle null input safely.
Write a method that checks a username string is between 5 and 15 characters long and contains only letters and digits. Return true if valid, false otherwise. Must handle null or empty input safely.
Write a method that checks if a given string contains at least one digit (0-9). Return true if yes, false otherwise. Must safely handle null or empty input.
Write a method that verifies a month integer is between 1 and 12. Return true if valid, false otherwise. Must handle invalid or out-of-range values safely.
Write a method that checks if a string contains only alphanumeric characters (A-Z, a-z, 0-9). Return true if yes, false otherwise. Must handle null safely.
Write a method that checks whether a file size (given as long) falls within a safe range (e.g., 0 to 10,000,000). Return true if safe, false otherwise. Must handle negative or invalid inputs.
Write a method that checks if a year integer is between 1900 and 2100 inclusive. Return true if valid, false otherwise. Must handle negative or extremely large inputs safely.

Write a method that checks if the local-part (before the '@') of an email address is valid: contains only letters, digits, dots or underscores. Return true if valid, false otherwise. Must handle null safely.
Write a method that checks if a given string ends with a specific suffix. Return true if yes, false otherwise. Must handle null safely.
Write a method that checks if a string is a valid domain name (letters, digits, hyphens separated by dots). Return true if valid, false otherwise. Must safely handle null or empty input.
Write a method that parses a string in the form "--key=value" and returns a Map with the key and value. Return null if the format is invalid. Must validate input safely and not throw exceptions.
Write a method that checks if a string represents a valid 10-digit phone number (digits only). Return true if valid, false otherwise. Must safely handle null or non-digit input.
Write a method that checks if an integer day is between 1 and 31 inclusive. Return true if valid, false otherwise. Must handle out-of-range values safely.
Write a method that checks whether adding two integers will overflow. Return true if safe, false otherwise. Must not throw exceptions for extreme input.
Write a method that converts strings "true" or "false" (case-insensitive) to Boolean, and returns null for invalid input. Must handle null safely.
Write a method that checks if a string is a valid 6-digit hex color code (e.g., "#1A2B3C"). Return true if valid, false otherwise. Must handle null safely.
Write a method that checks whether a username string contains only letters, digits and underscores, and is not empty. Return true if valid, false otherwise. Must handle null safely.

Write a method that checks a domain label (part of a domain name) contains only letters, digits or hyphen, does not start or end with hyphen. Return true if valid, false otherwise. Must safely handle null or empty input.

Write a method that checks if a string contains potentially dangerous SQL characters or keywords like single quotes, semicolons, or SQL keywords (SELECT, DROP, etc.). Return true if safe, false if potentially dangerous. Must handle null input safely.

Write a method that checks if a string matches a basic credit card number format (13-19 digits, spaces optional). Return true if format is valid, false otherwise. Must handle null safely. Note: This does not validate the actual card number validity using Luhn algorithm.
Write a method that checks if a string is a valid MAC address in format XX:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX (hexadecimal digits). Return true if valid, false otherwise. Must handle null input safely.

Write a method that checks if a string is a valid XML tag name (starts with letter or underscore, contains only letters, digits, hyphens, underscores, or periods). Return true if valid, false otherwise. Must handle null safely.
Write a method that checks whether multiplying two integers will overflow. Return true if safe, false otherwise. Must use proper overflow detection without triggering exceptions.
Write a method that checks if a string is valid Base64 encoding (only A-Z, a-z, 0-9, +, /, = characters, with proper padding). Return true if valid, false otherwise. Must handle null safely.
